column4: Hello again. I have another question. I've installed Adobe Reader 9 by downloading the file AdbeRdr9.3.2-1_i386linux_enu.deb from Adobe and installing it using the GDebi Package Installer. Now I want to uninstall it. It seems to me that GDebi doesn't uninstall stuff, so how do I go about uninstalling this .deb package?
gnome?
i think most do as long as the fonts are installed
that's a langauge support package. is xpdf installed?
i think that maybe the default pdf viewer installed with Ubuntu.
you can try that, or select xpdf from the list
/usr/bin is equivalent to c:/program files
what's the ext. for the file?
download the file. then via terminal navigate to the directory it's in. run "chmod +x <filename>", then "./<Filename>"
chmod +x <filename> set's the script to be an executable. and ./ runs it
INSTALL is usually a file included with src packages on how to compile/install it
it's a script file. there's no INSTALL file because it is an executable itself
follow the instructions I said a couple of minutes ago on how to install it
installable executables don't communicate with package manager
install scripts are the same as on windows. they install separately and they have their own unistall file
an install is just a bunch of files in a directory. If worse somes to worse you just remove the directory
scite is good
scite is nice and simple.

I just installed Scite and tried opening the tex file. Now, instead of boxes, I see little black boxes with ESC written inside them...  Going to File>Encoding brings up a number of UTF options, but not the Japanese encoding I need...
you maybe missing some fonts
try changing the font in scite first
do you happen to know offhand how to change fonts in scite? It doesn't seem to be in the menus.
i think there's a menu option to open the config file (no gui). do a search for font and it should be in there somewhere. Or you can try with gedit instead
